entry.title: PCR for PF Calculation Using Processed Basic
entry.content:
Dear Expert,

An employee has a basic wage type 1000 in Infotype 0008 with an amount of 30,000. He was on Leave Without Pay  (Action) for 10 days (11‚Äì15, 21‚Äì25) and therefore remained inactive during this period. After the factoring and storage process in the schema, the wage type 1000 amount is reduced to 20,322.58, which is working correctly.

The issue arises with the PF wage type 1101 in Infotype 0014. The PF is expected to be calculated as a percentage (e.g., 20%) of the employee‚Äôs factored basic pay. However, the system is not considering the factored basic (20,322.58) for the calculation.

Payroll Schema

Z023 - (storing the basic salary after factoring)

The factored basic salary is not being stored in BVER. I believe this is the issue, as the value cannot be read 

ZREC - ( PF calculation rule)

If I use the code mentioned below, only the amounts for Basic01 and Basic02 are read; it does not work for general employees.

AMT+E 1000 - 9,677.42
AMT+R 1000 - 5,806.45 

 

The PF should be calculated as 20% of 20,322.58 = 4,064.52, but this adjustment is currently missing.

Kindly review and suggest a solution.

@sikindar_a

entry.title: Mass creation of RFQ in S/4 hana system
entry.content:
Hello,

 

We are recently migrated from ECC to S/4 HANA. In S/4, Manage RFQs Fiori app is using instead of ME41 in ECC. We need to create large number of RFQs in the new system.

Hence, we are requesting you to suggest for the option of creating RFQs in Mass (Multiple RFQ with Multiple Suppliers) by using Fiori app.

 

Thanks & regards


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Mass creation of RFQ in S/4 hana system
entry.content:
Hello,

In the Manage RFQs app, you can only create one RFQs at a time. Also, there is no app to create RFQs in bulk. 
More details can be found in KBA 2115337.

You can evaluate with your local Consultant Team the possibility of developing a custom solution using APIs. Detailed information about this feature can be found on this SAP Help page: Request for Quotation - Create, Update, Delete

Best regards, 
Tatiana

entry.title: SAP BTP CI CD service for on premise S4 HANA systems RICEFW applications
entry.content:
Hi,

Can we use SAP BTP CI CD service for premise S4 HANA systems RICEFW applications deployment? There are only 4 pre-configured pipelines (Cloud Foundry Environment, SAP Fiori for ABAP Platform, SAP Integration Suite Artifacts, Kyma Runtime )available in CI CD service.  Which pipeline to use for this on premise scenario?

Example scenario :

On premise ABAP objects development like ABAP programs written in SE38, data dictionary objects created in SE11, enhancements, smartforms, webservices etc are developed in on-premise SAP S4 HANA development system. The transport request numbers are released and are pushed to Github repository via gCTS fiori app as commits.  SAP BTP CI CD pipeline job should trigger and perform the automated testing and deployment to target on premise systems(not the subaccounts but to on premise target systems like QA and production).

How to design this on-premise scenario with SAP BTP CI CD pipeline? How to automate and configure ATC checks, unit tests, integration testing, end to end testing?

Can anybody please provide inputs?

Regards,

Sunil

entry.title: Re: CAT2 is showing error message
entry.content:
Hello @Anas71 

For S/4HANA Public Cloud, please note that CAT2/KP26 are not available. The KL001 code generally indicates that the cost center‚Äìactivity type master is missing for the current fiscal year.

To fix this, create or extend TMOD‚Üî1020001 in Manage Activity Types set for 2025 and update the 2025 price in Maintain Activity Price. Afterwards, test with Post Direct Activity Allocation. Also, verify that the cost center category allows activity allocation and that CO periods are open. If problems persist.You can raise an incident with all relevant details to SAP.

You can watch this useful SAP VIDEO SAP Help Financial Planning-Coster Center Activity Cost Rate Calculation-Video

SAP KBA 2864151 ‚Äì Cost Center Category for Activity Types in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition  Why it is necessary for the cost center category to allow activity allocation.

SAP KBA 3108513 ‚Äì CR091 error when inputting activity type into Work Center This isn't your exact message, but it includes important checks on activity types, CC assignments, and their validity.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Extensibility in the Age of AI: Why ABCD Is Easier (and Smarter) Than You Think
entry.content:
The CTO‚Äôs Concern

Not long ago, during a client conversation, a CTO expressed a concern that resonated deeply:

‚ÄúWe need to extend our system. But every time someone says ‚Äòlet‚Äôs customize this,‚Äô I feel we‚Äôre piling risk. And now with AI coming, I‚Äôm afraid our mess gets worse.‚Äù

That statement captures the heart of a challenge many SAP customers face. Customization has been both the strength and the Achilles‚Äô heel of enterprise landscapes. It allows us to adapt, innovate, and differentiate ‚Äî but it often comes with technical debt, upgrade pain, and hidden complexity.

Why Extensibility Matters More in the AI Era

Let‚Äôs pause here. Ten years ago, if you added a Z-table or tweaked a user exit, the worst-case scenario was some testing pain during an upgrade. Today?

  • If your data model is inconsistent, your AI forecasts won‚Äôt align with reality.
  • If your logic is buried in old exits, Joule copilots can‚Äôt ‚Äúsee‚Äù your processes.
  • If your core is brittle, cloud updates feel like risks, not opportunities.

In other words: extensibility is no longer just about ‚Äúmaking it work.‚Äù It‚Äôs about making AI possible.

And now, with SAP‚Äôs AI ambitions accelerating ‚Äî embedded copilots, Joule agents, and business data clouds powering predictive intelligence ‚Äî the messy customizations of the past risk becoming blockers for the future.

This is where ABCD extensibility comes in. Far from being abstract jargon, it‚Äôs a practical compass to guide enterprises on how to extend the system smartly, safely, and in a way that enables AI instead of hindering it.

The ABCD Levels: A Human Explanation

SAP‚Äôs ABCD framework doesn‚Äôt exist to confuse us ‚Äî it exists to help customers navigate the grey space between innovation and stability.

Here‚Äôs the official breakdown, with real-world translation:

A Short Story: The MV45AFZZ Debate

Anyone who has worked in SAP Sales and Distribution knows the legendary include MV45AFZZ. For decades, it‚Äôs been the go-to spot for developers to implement custom sales order checks, validations, and logic.

At one client, a senior developer proudly said, ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve been using MV45AFZZ for 15 years, and it works just fine. Why change?‚Äù

And he wasn‚Äôt wrong. In many ways, that‚Äôs a Level B extensibility choice: small, controlled, and serving the business well. (In fact, SAP even documented this in SAP Note 3578329, proving that not all ‚Äòold-school‚Äô practices are bad.)

The problem comes when dozens of such exits pile up, undocumented, with overlapping logic ‚Äî and suddenly the system feels like a house of cards.

Here‚Äôs the twist: ABCD extensibility is not about banning MV45AFZZ or exits. It‚Äôs about putting them in the right place, with the right intent.

The IDoc Question: Clean or Not?

One of the most common debates I hear is: ‚ÄúWe use IDocs everywhere. Are they clean core?‚Äù

The answer: Yes, IDocs are safe ‚Äî they fall under Level B.

SAP clarified this in the IDoc Clean Core blog.

Why? Because IDocs are:

  • Officially documented.
  • Supported by SAP.
  • Used for integration and still relevant in S/4HANA.

That said, if you‚Äôre starting a greenfield cloud project, you may want to move toward APIs and Event Mesh (Level A) instead. But if you‚Äôve got an existing landscape with IDocs, don‚Äôt panic ‚Äî they‚Äôre not ‚Äúunclean.‚Äù

Real-World Scenarios: Which Level to Choose?

Why This Matters for AI

AI copilots like Joule don‚Äôt ‚Äúguess.‚Äù They rely on:

  • Stable APIs (Level A).
  • Clear data models (A & B).
  • Trusted logic (not buried in Level C/D).

If your system is full of Level D hacks, AI copilots won‚Äôt understand your processes. But if you steer toward A and B (with C monitored), you create an AI-ready enterprise.

 Closing Thought

Extensibility is not the villain. Misuse is.

The ABCD framework gives us a shared language:

  • A when we want innovation + AI without worry.
  • B when proven frameworks like IDocs or MV45AFZZ still serve us.
  • C only if there‚Äôs no choice ‚Äî and we track it closely.
  • D only if we want to leave a headache for the next generation.

So next time someone says ‚Äúlet‚Äôs customize,‚Äù you don‚Äôt need to panic. You just need to ask:

Is this A, B, C, or D? And that one question can mean the difference between a system that blocks AI ‚Äî and one that accelerates it.

#SAPCleanCore #SAPExtensibility #ABAPCloud #SAPAI #SAPBTP #S4HANACloud #IDoc

entry.title: Best (intermediate) architecture for ATC - two ABAP landscapes (S/4 & GTS)??
entry.content:
Hi all experts, especially ATC-folks...

We have ATC established for an S/4HANA-landscape using the Dev-system both as checking and checked system.
Now, we got a second ABAP landscape used for GTS and I am thinking/reading about how to setup the ATC in the best/most efficient way.
I am hoping to get confirmation (or better advice, if I am on the wrong track) that it is a viable option to continue using the S/4-Dev as central checking system and now, in addition connecting and enabling the GTS-Dev-system as remotely checked system?

This architecture I see as an intermediate state before we at a later point in time will switch to using central ATC on BTP.

Hoping to get some comments on this shortly sketched-out scenario or questions to further clarify the scenario... All input is highly appreciated.

//Ingo

entry.title: How to have unified HU in EWM?
entry.content:
Currently, in my scenario, I have a 1-to-1 configuration for HUs. That is, if there are 200 units of an item in stock, 200 HUs will be generated.

The requirement is to have a HU with a higher quantity. I achieved this via PACKSPEC. However, when another receipt arrives, it generates another HU, and I want it to add the items if the existing HU has space.

Any tips on how to do this?

Currently, my minimum process is:

Purchase requisition -> Purchase order -> Receipt -> Blind Count (RFUI) -> PRDI

Immediately after the blind count, the HU is generated along with the tasks in PRDI.

entry.title: Urgent Purchasing with Purchase Requisition Workflow in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud-1
entry.content:
Introduction:
In the world of procurement, speed can sometimes matter as much as compliance. Purchase Requisitions (PRs) are great for capturing business needs, but let‚Äôs be honest‚Äîthere are moments when waiting for the usual approval cycle simply isn‚Äôt an option. Maybe it‚Äôs a critical spare part, or maybe a project deadline is on the line. Whatever the case, you need a way to move things along quickly, without breaking governance rules.
SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud already gives us a pretty solid workflow framework for PRs. The catch, though, is that the standard setup doesn‚Äôt always capture those urgent, real-life situations. And that‚Äôs exactly where extensibility comes into play.
This blog shows you how to extend the workflow by adding a custom condition called ‚ÄúUrgent Purchasing.‚Äù With this in place, whenever a PR item is marked as urgent, the system knows to push it straight to the right approvers‚Äîhelping you strike that tricky balance between speed and control.
Business Requirement:

  • Create a new Purchase Requisition (PR) approval workflow for Urgent Purchasing line items
  • Trigger the PR workflow only when this condition is true
  • Keep it flexible so it can be reused or adapted later

Process Flow Approach:
To meet this requirement, the standard extensibility options in SAP S/4HANA Cloud are utilized:

  • Custom Field ‚Üí A checkbox field at the PR item level to flag whether it‚Äôs ‚ÄúUrgent Purchasing‚Äù
  • Custom Logic ‚Üí To define and evaluate the start condition for the workflow
  • Manage Workflows for Purchase Requisition App ‚Üí To configure the condition into the workflow

Step 1: Creation of Custom Field for Purchase Requisitions:
Created a custom field for PR items using the Custom Fields app.
Process:
Go to Custom Fields ‚Üí click + (Create)

Fill in the following:

Business Context: Procurement: Purchase Requisition Item (MM_PURREQN_ITEM)

  • Label: Urgent Purchasing
  • Identifier: UrgentPurchasing
  • Tooltip: Urgent Purchasing
  • Type: Checkbox

After creation, the relevant UIs, reports, and analytics are enabled. The new field is added to the UI by adapting the screen and adding the new field.

Adding and Verifying the Custom Field in Purchase Requisition:
Click on Adapt UI ‚Üí Add the Custom Field ‚ÜíVerify the Custom Field ‚ÄúUrgent Purchasing‚Äù.

Step 2: Adding ‚ÄúUrgent Purchasing‚Äù As a Start Condition to the Workflow for Purchase Requisition:
This step defines the 'Urgent Purchasing' condition, so that it appears as a start condition in the workflow configuration.
Creating Custom logic for the ‚ÄúUrgent Purchasing‚Äù as below:
1. Process Flow: Go to Custom Logic App ‚Üí Click on Create ‚Üí Enter the Following Information.
2. Business Context: Procurement: Start and Pre-Conditions in Flexible Workflow
3. Extension Point: SWF_WORKFLOW_CONDITION_DEF
                                                                                Click on Step 2:
Click on the Add Button:
SCENARIO_ID: WS02000471
                                                                                Click on Step 3:
Implementation Description: Providing Additional Conditions for Scenarios
Implementation ID: YY1_PURCHASEREQUISITIONITEMS

            Click on Create and Publish
            Click on Open Editor and write the logic for ‚ÄúUrgent Purchasing‚Äù

Logic Code:
DATA: ls_condition LIKE LINE OF ct_condition,
ls_parameter LIKE LINE OF ct_parameter.

" Condition 1: Urgent Purchasing
ls_condition-id = '1'.
ls_condition-subject = 'Urgent Purchasing'.
ls_condition-type = if_swf_flex_ifs_condition_def=>cs_condtype-start_step.
APPEND ls_condition TO ct_condition.

ls_parameter-id = '1'.
ls_parameter-name = 'Urgent Purchasing'.
ls_parameter-shorttext = 'Urgent Purchasing'.
ls_parameter-xsd_type = if_swf_flex_ifs_condition_def=>cs_xstype-boolean.
ls_parameter-mandatory = abap_false.
APPEND ls_parameter TO ct_parameter.
Verifying the ‚ÄúUrgent Purchasing‚Äù at ‚ÄúStart Condition‚Äù of Purchase Requisition Workflow:

Step 3: Create Evaluation Custom Logic for Workflow
Once the condition existed, I needed logic to evaluate whether it was true for a given PR item.
Evaluation logic for the ‚ÄúUrgent Purchasing‚Äù is as follows:
1. Process Flow: Go to Custom Logic App ‚Üí Click on Create ‚Üí Enter the Following Information.
2. Business Context: Procurement: Start and Pre-Conditions in Flexible Workflow
3. Extension Point: SWF_WORKFLOW_CONDITION_EVAL

                                                                                  Click on Step 2
Click on the Add Button:
SCENARIO_ID: WS02000471
                                                                                 Click on Step 3
Implementation Description: Evaluation Logic for Purchase Requisition Workflow Condition
Implementation ID: YY1_EVALUATIONLOOPB_WPR

           Click on Create and Publish
          Click on Open Editor and write the logic for ‚ÄúUrgent Purchasing‚Äù

Logic Code for Evaluation:
" BAdI: Evaluation of Workflow Conditions for PR Item

DATA: ls_item TYPE i_purchaserequisitionitemapi01.

cv_is_true = abap_false.

" Ensure we have both PR and Item key
IF is_sap_object_node_type-sont_key_part_1 IS INITIAL OR
is_sap_object_node_type-sont_key_part_2 IS INITIAL.
RETURN.
ENDIF.

" Read the specific Purchase Requisition Item
SELECT SINGLE *
FROM i_purchaserequisitionitemapi01
WHERE purchaserequisition = @IS_sap_object_node_type-sont_key_part_1
AND purchaserequisitionitem = @IS_sap_object_node_type-sont_key_part_2
INTO @LS_item.
IF sy-subrc < > 0.
RETURN.
ENDIF.

" Condition 1: Urgent Purchasing
IF is_condition-condition_id = '1'.
" Adjust according to how the extension field stores the flag
IF ls_item-YY1_Urgent Purchasing = 'X'
OR ls_item-YY1_Urgent Purchasing = abap_true
OR ls_item-YY1_Urgent Purchasing = 'true'.
cv_is_true = abap_true.
ENDIF.
ENDIF.

Step 4: Creation of Workflow based on Custom Field
Use the Manage Workflows for Purchase Requisitions app to add the new start condition.

  • Navigate to the workflow scenario.
  • Add the custom condition Urgent Purchasing.
  • Define the workflow steps (e.g., approval by the Urgent Purchase owner).

Results:
After putting this together, PR workflows are now automatically triggered if an item is flagged as urgent purchasing.
Some key benefits:

  • 100% in-app extensibility, no modifications to SAP standard objects
  • Business-specific conditions integrated seamlessly with the standard workflow


Conclusion:
This small enhancement really shows the power of SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud extensibility. By combining custom fields and logic with flexible workflows, it‚Äôs possible to adapt standard processes to unique business needs‚Äîwithout complex development.
If your organization faces similar challenges with urgent purchasing, compliance, or approval rules, this approach is worth considering.

Faisal Abbas

Application Cosnultant SAP S/4 HANA Public Cloud

Navigator Business Solutions

entry.title: Service Layer ‚Äì Unable to Close Inventory Transfer Request (Error -1 detected during transaction)
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I‚Äôm trying to use the Service Layer to close an Inventory Transfer Request.

I tested using:

 

http
Copy
POST https://localhost:50000/b1s/v2/InventoryTransferRequests(123)/Close

 

POST https://localhost:50000/b1s/v2/InventoryTransferRequests(123)/Close

Or:

 

http
Copy
POST https://localhost:50000/b1s/v2/InventoryTransferRequests(123) { "Comments": "new comments - modified by Service Layer" }

 

POST https://localhost:50000/b1s/v2/InventoryTransferRequests(123) { "Comments": "new comments - modified by Service Layer" }

In both cases, I get the following error:

 

json
Copy
{ "error": { "code": -1116, "message": { "lang": "en-us", "value": "Could not commit transaction: Error -1 detected during transaction" } } }

 

{ "error": { "code": -1116, "message": { "lang": "en-us", "value": "Could not commit transaction: Error -1 detected during transaction" } } }

If I perform the same operation manually in the SAP B1 client, it works fine.

I also tried closing the lines first and then the document, but I still get the same error:

 

http
Copy
PATCH https://localhost:50000/b1s/v2/InventoryTransferRequests(123) { "DocumentStatus": "bost_Close", "StockTransferLines": [ { "LineNum": 0, "DocEntry": 123, "ItemCode": "000-000102", "LineStatus": "bost_Close" }, { "LineNum": 3, "DocEntry": 123, "ItemCode": "000-000117", "LineStatus": "bost_Close" } ] }
PATCH https://localhost:50000/b1s/v2/InventoryTransferRequests(123) { "DocumentStatus": "bost_Close", "StockTransferLines": [ { "LineNum": 0, "DocEntry": 123, "ItemCode": "000-000102", "LineStatus": "bost_Close" }, { "LineNum": 3, "DocEntry": 123, "ItemCode": "000-000117", "LineStatus": "bost_Close" } ] }

‚û°Ô∏è Question: What is the correct way to close an Inventory Transfer Request through the Service Layer? Is there any limitation or specific requirement before calling the /Close action?

Thanks in advance for your help!

entry.title: October 2 Employee Central Live Session
entry.content:
Thank you to everyone who attended the Employee Central Live Session on October 2. 

This session was the second part of the five-day Employee Central Workshop series, which focuses on activating the core functions of Employee Central from scratch. 

Here's a brief summary of Day 2‚ÄîConfiguring Foundation Objects:

  • The Foundation Objects Configuration Workbook serves as a baseline for capturing customer requirements related to Foundation Objects
  • The tools used for configuring XML-based Foundation Objects are:
    • Corporate Data Models
    • Manage Organization Pay and Job Structures
    • Import Foundation Data
  • The tools used for configuring MDF-based Foundation Objects are:
    • Configure Object Definition
    • Manage Data, 
    • Import and Export Data
  • Composite Associations are used to create a parent-child relationship
  • Valid-When Associations are used to establish hierarchy levels in the organization structure
  • The order of data import depends on the associations configured between the objects.

You can find the presentation when you log in to https://learning.sap.com. Go to My Learning > Live Sessions. 

Thank you.

entry.title: October 1 Employee Central Live Session
entry.content:
Thank you to everyone who attended the Employee Central Live Session on October 1. 

This session was part of the 5-day series Employee Central Workshop which focuses on activating the core functions of Employee Central from scratch. 

Here's a brief summary of Day 1- Provisioning and Other Initial Configurations:

  • The list of provisioning settings to enable Employee Central's core functionality is listed in the Implementing Employee Central - Basic Settings section
  • A super admin is created in provisioning to create a security administrator who will then manage the RBP groups and roles
  • The set of standard picklists called "Master Picklist" must be uploaded to support the fields that have picklist references
  • The four data models used in Employee Central must be uploaded in this order:
    • Corporate Data Model
    • Country-specific Corporate Data Model
    • Succession Data Model
    • Country-specific Succession Data Model

You can find the presentation when you log in to https://learning.sap.com. Go to My Learning > Live Sessions. 

Thank you.

entry.title: From Penalty to Power Play: Why Identity Management Is Key to Better Customer Experiences
entry.content:
A few weeks ago, a friend bought tickets to a hockey game and wanted to transfer them to me. Like many people, we went with the quickest workaround‚Äîshe shared her login credentials so I could access the tickets. But what should have been a simple process turned into several days of password resets, missed messages, and back-and-forth. By the time I finally got into her account, the tickets were gone. She had attempted to transfer them during the delay, but amid the confusion and technical issues, I never actually received them. If I had been able to log in right away, I could have just downloaded them directly. But the access issues created confusion, and without any clear support from the platform, we ended up losing the tickets‚Äîand missing the game.

It was a simple plan that fell apart because of something as basic as account access.

This experience is a small example of a much larger issue in digital commerce: the friction that arises when identity management isn‚Äôt built with the customer in mind. It‚Äôs easy to overlook, but poor identity experiences lead directly to lost opportunities‚Äînot just for consumers, but for the businesses trying to reach them.

 

Identity Friction = Lost Revenue

In today‚Äôs commerce landscape, customer expectations are sky-high. If a login process is confusing, if an account is hard to access, or if personalization feels off‚Äîpeople walk away. And often, they don‚Äôt come back.

Poor identity experiences hurt businesses in more ways than one:

  • They interrupt the buying journey. Whether it‚Äôs a login loop, a forgotten password, or a complicated checkout flow, friction at these key points drives abandonment.
  • They block personalization. When customer data is fragmented across systems, it‚Äôs hard to deliver the tailored experiences that today‚Äôs buyers expect.
  • They erode trust. Without clear consent management and transparency, customers hesitate to share information‚Äîor stop engaging entirely.
  • They slow down growth. Outdated systems and homegrown solutions often can‚Äôt keep up with omnichannel strategies or evolving compliance needs.

For a deeper dive into how SAP CIAM can help reduce identity friction, join us at SAP TechEd on November 6 for a dedicated CIAM security session. Register here to secure your spot and learn more.

 

Where SAP CIAM + Commerce Cloud Make the Difference

Customer Identity and Access Management (CIAM) helps solve these challenges by making identity work for the customer‚Äînot against them. When integrated into your commerce ecosystem, CIAM doesn't just handle sign-ins‚Äîit actively supports better customer relationships and business outcomes.

Here‚Äôs how:

  • It reduces friction at every stage‚Äîfrom anonymous browsing to account creation to repeat purchases. The experience becomes smoother, simpler, and more secure.
  • It improves conversion by enabling personalized, real-time engagement without relying on clunky data handoffs or third-party cookies.
  • It builds trust by giving customers control over their data, preferences, and permissions‚Äîwhile helping businesses stay compliant across regions.
  • It supports scale by integrating identity across every digital touchpoint, enabling consistent experiences on web, mobile, in-store, and beyond.

In short, CIAM allows businesses to move away from fragmented, frustrating interactions and toward a unified customer experience that feels intuitive, safe, and relevant‚Äîevery time. To hear firsthand how SAP customers are achieving this with SAP CIAM and Commerce Cloud, join us at SAP Connect in Las Vegas on October 8. Register here to attend.

 

The Takeaway

In commerce, moments of friction are more than just annoyances‚Äîthey‚Äôre missed opportunities. Whether it‚Äôs lost hockey tickets or lost revenue, the cause is often the same: a broken identity experience.

Modern CIAM, especially when combined with a powerful commerce platform, turns identity into an asset. It streamlines the journey, protects the user, and empowers businesses to engage with clarity and confidence.

And the best part? It just works‚Äîso your customers don‚Äôt have to. 

Learn more here.

entry.title: Re: confidential enterprise projects
entry.content:
Hello @tomlovelock 

Besides Chris's comments, restrict access to ETO/defence projects so that only users with a ‚Äúusers assigned access basis can view them.

Follow this process below

Assign the project to an Authorisation Group in the Enterprise Project field.

In' Maintain Business Roles, ' set Restrictions ‚Üí Read to' Restricted' for the project apps, and specify the allowed Authorisation Group values for each role.

For highly sensitive work, set Confidential Project to true and keep a small, designated project team; only authorised roles and members will see it.

This concludes the process; there is no necessity for cost-center modifications. Conduct a test using two roles‚Äîone inclusive of the group value and the other excluding it‚Äîand verify visibility.

Authoritative references

  • Maintain Business Role Restrictions ‚Äì how to restrict by fields (set Read to Restricted and keep values). 
  • SAP Help Portal-Identity and Access Management-How to Define Authorisations Based on Restrictions
  • Enterprise Project CDS (I_ENTERPRISEPROJECT) shows AuthorizationGroup and ConfidentialProject fields used for the controls above. SAP Business Accelerator Hub-I_EnterprisedProject(Basic)

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: SAP BTP Trial Establish Trust issue
entry.content:
Hello everyone.

I am currently trying to complete a mission on SAP.com using a trial account. I have created a new trial subaccount and added the SAP Cloud Identity Services. The service appears to be added successfully.

However, when I go to Security ‚Üí Trust Configuration and try to click Establish Trust, I keep getting an error message like the one in the screenshot.

I have already tried the following steps:

  1. Deleted and recreated the trial account.
  2. Added the Cloud Identity Service again.
  3. Created azure instead of amazon.
  4. Repeated the process several times, but the problem remained.

It seems that the subaccount cannot interact properly with IAS (possibly a problem with the tenant registry).

Could you please help me understand why my trial account cannot establish trust?

Thank you in advance for your help!

entry.title: SAP Build Apps Booster Fails at "Checking Custom Identity Provider" with Unexpected Internal Error
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I am trying to activate the SAP Build Apps booster in my SAP BTP trial global account. The process consistently fails at the "Check Prerequisites" step, specifically at "Checking Custom Identity Provider", with the following error message:

"We are sorry, but we have encountered an unexpected internal error. Please try again later."

As a result, subsequent checks including "Checking Entitlements" are skipped and the booster setup cannot complete.

  • I have clicked the Rerun button several times, but the error persists.

  • The trial account was created recently and I am following the standard booster activation steps.

  • Attached is a screenshot showing the error for additional context.

     

Has anyone else faced this issue recently or does anyone know a solution/workaround? Is this a backend issue on SAP's side? Any guidance from SAP support would be appreciated, as I'm unable to proceed with my SAP Build Apps trial.

Thank you in advance!
#btp

entry.title: Implementing a Dynamic YTD Filter Up to Yesterday in SAP Story
entry.content:
Hi all,

I want to set up a dynamic YTD filter in an SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) story that always goes up to the previous day. The goal is for the filter to automatically consider the current year, but have the end date update daily.

Important: On the first day of the month, the filter should show the last day of the previous month, not the current month‚Äôs first day

I tried to use the Offset  function for selecting the previous day but this didnt work when I try to Show YTD for the current year.

Best,

Moritz

entry.title: Re: Connection between Process Insight and S/4HANA. Error...
entry.content:

entry.title: Customizing Your PDF with the Categories of Class A Invoices
entry.content:
Hello!  

In this blog, we will walk you through the steps of designing the new PDF templates using Adobe LiveCycle to remain compliant with R.G. N¬∞ 5762/2025 and R.G. N¬∞5764/2025 for Argentina. 

If you carry out sales, work placements or provision of services in Argentina using print character M for VAT-registered taxpayers, according to resolution R.G. N¬∞ 5762/2025 and R.G. N¬∞5764/2025, as of December 1, 2025, you must replace the existing class M invoices with the new categories of Class A invoices: 

Categories of Class A Invoices 

Description 

What you need to do 

Standard Class A 

For taxpayers meeting all fiscal and solvency requirements 

Nothing 

Class A with legend ‚ÄúOPERACI√ìN SUJETA A RETENCI√ìN‚Äù 

For taxpayers who do not meet certain requirements 

You design a new PDF template 

Class A with legend ‚ÄúPAGO EN CBU INFORMADA‚Äù 

For taxpayers who may not meet solvency criteria, requiring payments to be made to a specific, declared bank account (CBU) 

You design a new PDF template 

Prerequisites: 

  • You have‚ÄØAdobe LiveCycle Designer‚ÄØon your computer and know how to design forms with this tool.‚ÄØ 
  • You have assigned the‚ÄØExtensibility‚ÄØ(SAP_CORE_BC_EXT) authorization role for your user.‚ÄØ 

Procedure: 

1. Access the‚ÄØMaintain Form Templates‚ÄØ(F1434) app.  

2. Go to the‚ÄØPredelivered Templates‚ÄØtab and search for the following PDF form:‚ÄØ 

Document Type: 

Print Char A, B, E 

Form Template Name: 

EDO_AR_PRINT 

Data Source: 

EDOC_AR_PRINT_SRV_03 

3. Open the form template and select‚ÄØDownload.‚ÄØ 

4. Extract the downloaded ZIP file and open the‚ÄØ.xdp‚ÄØfile in the‚ÄØAdobe Livecycle Desginer.‚ÄØ 

5. In the‚ÄØAdobe LifeCycle Designer, choose the‚ÄØMaster Pages‚ÄØtab.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 

6. From the‚ÄØObject Library, drag and drop a Text onto the PageType box of your PDF. (Note: We suggest placing the Text on the bottom left corner of the PageType box.)  

7. On the Hierarchy tab, select the new field (default name Text1) and open the context menu (right-click or press Shift+F10). Choose Rename, type Legenda, and press Enter.  

8. Edit the new Legenda text. Insert the respective text value: ‚ÄúPAGO EN CBU INFORMADA‚Äù or ‚ÄúOPERACI√ìN SUJETA A RETENCI√ìN‚Äù. 

9. On the Hierarchy tab, select the content field. 

10. After selecting the content field, open the Script Editor (default shortcut Ctrl+Shift+F5) and insert the following Javascript logic to configure Legenda field:  

if (this.resolveNode("sfHeader.content.var_PrintChar").rawValue == 'A' ) { 
  this.resolveNode("sfHeader.content.Legenda").presence = "visible"; 
} else { 
this.resolveNode("sfHeader.content.Legenda").presence = "hidden"; 
}

11. Save and name your template. 

12. Access the‚ÄØMaintain Form Templates‚ÄØ(F1434) app.‚ÄØ

13. On the‚ÄØCustom Templates‚ÄØtab, choose‚ÄØNew. Create a custom template for your form by making the following settings:‚ÄØ 

  • Form Template Name: Enter a name for your form template.‚ÄØ 
  • Language: Select the language of your form template.‚ÄØ 
  • Select Form Template File: Upload the file that you've created in‚ÄØAdobe LiveCycle Designer.‚ÄØ 
  • Data Source: EDOC_AR_PRINT_SRV_03‚ÄØ 
  • Form Type: Choose‚ÄØStandalone.‚ÄØ 

14. Save your form template.‚ÄØ 

15. In your configuration environment, use the search function to open the‚ÄØConfigure Printing Form for eInvoice‚ÄØ(103277)‚ÄØconfiguration activity and assign your custom form template to the relevant eDocument type and branch.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 

And that's it!

You can now open the eDocument Cockpit and submit your document. The PDF form templates you created contain the new categories of Class A invoices for VAT-registered taxpayers. 

Was this post helpful? Leave a like (kudo) and share the content with your colleagues. Feel free to leave feedback, comments, or questions in the space below.    

For more information, go to Document and Reporting Compliance for Argentina on the SAP Help Portal and make sure to follow‚ÄØSAP Document and Reporting Compliance.    

 

Regards, 

Jo√£o Pedro Braun Agnes & Pedro Brum

entry.title: Seeking Implementation Insight: Onboarding Compliance Forms,I-9, E-Verify
entry.content:
We‚Äôre implementing SAP SuccessFactors Recruiting + Onboarding with Employee Central as a mini-master (core HR remains PeopleSoft). We have high-volume hiring across disparate business groups and across a large swath of the United States.

I want to collect proven patterns and pitfalls from practitioners so our design is scalable, auditable, and maintainable. I‚Äôm especially interested in what worked in your implementation and what you‚Äôd do differently.

 
1) Reverification tracking (expiring work authorization)

  • For populations onboarded in SuccessFactors, how are you tracking document expirations and reverification (jobs, alerts, tiles, reports)?

  • What‚Äôs your operational cadence (owners, frequencies, escalations), and how do you reconcile with downstream HR (e.g., PeopleSoft) to avoid mismatches?

  • Any lessons on roles/permissions so teams see what they need without over-permissioning?

Examples welcome: sample alert configurations, job schedules, or a simple RACI for reverification.

2) Policy acknowledgements: unified vs. per-policy

  • Did you implement one consolidated ‚ÄúPolicy Acknowledgement‚Äù or maintain separate acknowledgements (e.g., handbook, IT, confidentiality)?

  • What choice improved audits (clearer scope of consent, easier version proof), and how do you link policy content (tiles, attachments) to the signed acknowledgement?

  • Tips for keeping signatures auditable and documents fresh?

SAP SuccessFactors Onboarding

entry.title: S/4HANA API for A_JournalEntryItemBasic changes order of results if $select fields
entry.content:
When I query using the REST API the A_JournalEntryItemBasic resource of the API_JOURNALENTRYITEMBASIC_SRV service, if I change the list of fields to retrieve, using the $select parameter, then the order of the results change. Even if I add an $orderby !

For example, I expect that a GET request to this two URLs return the same record (same ID, same URI) but represented with a different set of fields. Because I'm passing `$top=1` so only the first result should be returned:

  1. GET https://sandbox.api.sap.com//s4hanacloud/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_JOURNALENTRYITEMBASIC_SRV/A_JournalEntryItemBasic?%24top=1&%24select=ID%2CLedger%2CLedgerName%2CSourceLedger%2CLedg
    erFiscalYear%2CControllingArea%2CControllingAreaName%2CCompanyCode%2CCompanyCodeName%2CGLAccount%2CGLAccountName&%24orderby=Ledger
  2. GET https://sandbox.api.sap.com//s4hanacloud/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_JOURNALENTRYITEMBASIC_SRV/A_JournalEntryItemBasic?%24top=1&%24select=WBSElement%2CWBSElementDescription%2CPartnerCo
    mpanyCode%2CPartnerCompanyCodeName%2CCostCtrActivityType%2CCostCtrActivityTypeName%2COrderID%2CLedger&%24orderby=Ledger

But two different URIs are returned. First:

{'__metadata': {'id': "https://sandbox.api.sap.com/s4hanacloud/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_JOURNALENTRYITEMBASIC_SRV/A_JournalEntryItemBasic('.1~0C.3~0L.4~2018.5~A000.7~1010.9~0000000001')",
  'uri': "https://sandbox.api.sap.com/s4hanacloud/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_JOURNALENTRYITEMBASIC_SRV/A_JournalEntryItemBasic('.1~0C.3~0L.4~2018.5~A000.7~1010.9~0000000001')",
  'type': 'API_JOURNALENTRYITEMBASIC_SRV.A_JournalEntryItemBasicType'},
 'ID': '.1~0C.3~0L.4~2018.5~A000.7~1010.9~0000000001',
 'Ledger': '0C',
 'LedgerName': 'Management Accounting',
 'SourceLedger': '0L',
 'LedgerFiscalYear': '2018',
 'ControllingArea': 'A000',
 'ControllingAreaName': 'Controlling Area A000',
 'CompanyCode': '1010',
 'CompanyCodeName': 'BestRun DE',
 'GLAccount': '1',
 'GLAccountName': 'Paybls Domestic'}

And second:

{'__metadata': {'id': "https://sandbox.api.sap.com/s4hanacloud/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_JOURNALENTRYITEMBASIC_SRV/A_JournalEntryItemBasic('.1~0C.71~.73~.75~.77~')",
  'uri': "https://sandbox.api.sap.com/s4hanacloud/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_JOURNALENTRYITEMBASIC_SRV/A_JournalEntryItemBasic('.1~0C.71~.73~.75~.77~')",
  'type': 'API_JOURNALENTRYITEMBASIC_SRV.A_JournalEntryItemBasicType'},
 'Ledger': '0C',
 'WBSElement': '',
 'WBSElementDescription': '',
 'PartnerCompanyCode': '',
 'PartnerCompanyCodeName': '',
 'CostCtrActivityType': '',
 'CostCtrActivityTypeName': '',
 'OrderID': ''}

The OData specification says:

Select System Query Option ($select): A data service URI with a $select System Query Option identifies the same set of entities as a URI without a $select query option; however, the presence of a $select query option specifies that a response from the data service SHOULD return a subset, as identified by the value of the $select query option, of the properties that would have been returned had the URI not included a $select query option.

What am I missing?

 

UPDATE:
Apparently what I take as a row ID is actually a GENERATED_ID : a special property name used in OData services to uniquely identify aggregated or grouped data records. When you request aggregated data in an OData service, a GENERATED_ID property is automatically created for each resulting group. This ID serves as a unique key for that aggregated record, allowing you to request the same aggregated data again by referencing this ID.

So now, I don't know how to identify rows and thus how to match two rows from different queries. Can I rely on the order of the results?

entry.title: Re: Purchase Requisitions in the project
entry.content:
Hello @kailas_goley2 

This can be accomplished using the standard Project System (PS) in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud by managing the grouping of purchase requisitions.

The aim is to create separate PRs for BOM components and locally procured components.

Recommended configuration

Divide the sources into separate parts.

Implement two networks or dedicated activities within the project:

  • Assign BOM components to Network A.
  • Assign the Direct/Local Procurement components to Network B.

Enable Collective Purchase Requisition behaviour for network and component requirements.

This instructs the system to create separate PR documents for each network or activity, rather than merging all items into one PR.

Assign materials accordingly

BOM items are classified under Network A, while local or direct items fall under Network B.

Result: The MRP/requirements run will generate one PR for the BOM and another PR for locally procured items, each with separate PR numbers, rather than a single PR containing multiple lines.

Useful SAP References

  • SAP Learning Network Customising): The Collective PReq determines for each network whether a single purchase requisition with multiple items is created or multiple purchase requisitions with a single item each. SAP Learning-Customising Networks
  • SAP KBA 2539346 ‚Äì Multiple Purchase Requisitions from Network Activity (explains default grouping behaviour and why multiple items often end up in one PR without collective settings. SAP Support Portal-2539346 - Multiple Purchase Requisitions from Network Activity

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Optimizing Accessibility for Visual Impairment
entry.content:
According to the World Health Organization (WHO), at least 2.2 billion people have a visual impairment, ranging from mild vision loss to difficulties perceiving details, light, or movement[1]. However, accessibility isn‚Äôt just for people with permanent impairments. Inclusive design also benefits anyone dealing with everyday barriers, which can be situational or temporary impairments, like screen glare in the sun, eye strain after a long day, or simply forgetting their glasses.

A woman with a visual impairment smiles while holding a smartphone close to her face. Text reads: "2.2 Billion+ people worldwide have a visual impairment (WHO). SAP designs for those with vision impairments. Check out our tips for color contrast, text resizing and more!"

Design for Accessibility is Design for Everyone

When we design with accessibility in mind, we‚Äôre not just checking a box, we‚Äôre creating digital experiences that are easier to use for everyone. Making information more perceivable and tasks more achievable doesn‚Äôt just help some users; it makes products better across the board.

5 tips to Optimize Accessibility for Those with Visual Impairments

Designing with empathy starts with understanding the broad spectrum of visual ability‚Äîfrom permanent impairments to situational challenges. To help you translate this understanding into tangible action, SAP‚Äôs Accessibility Design Tools and the Inclusive Research Handbook offer a firm foundation. With these resources in mind, here are five tips to get you started:

1. Scalable Text and Components

  • Support scalable text and UI components without breaking layouts.
  • Ensure resizing is smooth without content overlap or truncation.
  • Why? When text or interface elements are too small or cannot be adjusted, users with visual impairments may have difficulty reading and using them effectively.

2. Color schemes

  • Use high-contrast color schemes and ensure sufficient contrast ratios for text and key UI elements.
  • Avoid relying on color alone to convey information.
  • Why? Low contrast can reduce the ability for users to distinguish interface elements and text.

3. Well-structured layouts

  • Design clean, well-structured layouts that adapt smoothly to smaller or magnified viewports, minimizing horizontal scrolling, and preserving hierarchy.
  • Why? Wide or cluttered layouts can overwhelm people with reduced visual fields or magnified views or those using magnification.

4. Testing

  • Test designs at various zoom levels to ensure readability and functionality remain intact.
  • Why? Users who rely on zooming or magnification tools may encounter distorted or broken interfaces if designs are not flexible and well-structured.

5. Spacing

  • Allow line height, letter spacing, and word spacing to adjust without cutting off text or breaking layouts.
  • Ensure readability when users apply custom spacing settings.
  • Why? Fixed text spacing can make it difficult for users with cognitive disabilities such as dyslexia to read text effectively.

How SAP Designs with Accessibility in Mind

Technology keeps changing, but our commitment to accessibility remains constant. We're focused on making sure innovation moves forward without leaving anyone behind. To achieve that goal, we are actively innovating how accessibility considerations can be integrated in all parts of the Product Development Lifecycle, especially in early phases like design.

Want to dig deeper? Explore SAP's existing Accessibility Design Tools and stay tuned for more!

 

References

1. World Health Organization, 2023: Fact Sheet on Blindness and Vision Impairment

entry.title: Re: Error in creating billing document in intercompany STO
entry.content:
Hello @yKim 

Thank you for the details. The error 'Tax statement item missing for tax code V0' occurs when a billing document includes a revenue line with tax code V0 sent to FI, but no output-tax condition line exists in pricing, preventing FI from creating the BSET tax line. In intercompany STO, SD tax is determined by the sales area of the supplying company, not by the PO tax code, which does not influence billing.

To reseove it, go to the billing document ‚Üí Pricing Analysis, ensure an output-tax condition is present, 0% is acceptable and that FI has a tax code V0 with G/L assignment. If not found, follow the next steps. KBA 3587141. If the intercompany STO master data is incomplete, follow KBA 3493622.

Let me know if you need further support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Value Help in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition always res...
entry.content:
Hello @Hiromu_Masuyama 

S/4HANA  Public Cloud does not currently include a standard feature to save last-used filters or automatically apply default filters in the value help dialog. Consider this as a design limitation of the current system help.

To control what appears in value help, apply authorisation-based restrictions on business roles. Set Read to Restricted which also limits Value Help and manage permitted values like Company Code, Sales Organisation, and Country, ensuring users only see entries they are authorised to access.

What you should do

In Maintain Business Roles ‚Üí Restrictions: set Read and thus Value Help to Restricted, then enter the allowed organisation values for that role. This permanently limits value help lists for those users.

For demonstrations, utilise a JP-only role or user (restricted to JP company code or sales organisation alongside the Personal Value List for quick selections.

Useful SAP References

SAP Help ‚Äì How to Define Authorisations Using Restrictions describes restricting access by entering values into restriction fields in business roles; read restrictions flow down to Value Help SAP Help Portal-Identity and Access Management-How to Define Authorisations Based on Restrictions

SAP Learning ‚Äì Maintaining Business Role Restrictions (explicitly states that Read set to Restricted lets you define which data is visible, and that Value Help inherits those restrictions). SAP Learning-Maintaining Business Role Restrictions

SAP Blog ‚Äì How to limit filter values in SAP Fiori apps best practice: implement explicit authorizations or restrictions to control the values users can view or select SAP Community-Maintaining Business Role Restrictions

Let me know if you need further support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Cancel Release in Approved purchase order
entry.content:
Hi @winpavan90 

Thank you for your question.

Consult Manage Purchase Orders & Flexible Workflow for Purchase Orders for more details.

To summarise, in public cloud, there is not Fiori app equivalent to ME29N for cancelling a purchase order release. Once a PO is approved through flexible workflow, the release cannot be directly revoked. If you need to stop a released PO, you can use the Manage Purchase Orders app to chang or block the PO, which will trigger a new workflow instance depending on your workflow configuration. Alternatively, you can design a flexible workflow to include a rejection or cancellation path if approvers need the ability to undo their approval.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: How to Be Linking Commercial Invoices Upload to Sales...
entry.content:
Hi @YY21 

Thank you for your question.

Consult Create Billing Documents, Billing Document & Manage Billing Documents for more details.

To summarise, in Public Cloud there is no standard app to upload commercial invoice numbers from Excel and link them to multiple sales orders. Commercial Invoices in SAP are represented by billing documents, which can be created collectively from sales orders by using the Create Billing Documents-Billing Due List app. If your requirement is to actually generate the invoices in SAP, that app is the standard solution.

If, however, you only need to register external invoice numbers managed in Excel, you have two options:

  • Use integration through the Billing Document APP to load invoice numbers from Excel into SAP and link them to sales orders, or
  • You build a Custom Business Object with Excel upload to store invoice references and map them to sales orders without creating SAP billing documents.

The right choice will depend on whether your Commercial Invoices should be financial posting in SAP or just external references.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Cancel Release in Approved purchase order
entry.content:
Hello @winpavan90 

In S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, there is no dedicated ‚ÄúCancel Release‚Äù function, and ME29N is not available. To reverse an approval, utilise one of these standard options:

There is no Cancel Release app and no ME29N.

To undo an approval, you restart Flexible Workflow by changing a field configured to trigger re-approval; the status then returns to ‚ÄúIn Approval‚Äù.

Alternatively, you can block the PO (header or item) or set it for deletion‚Äîthese actions halt follow-up processing but do not alter the approval history.

There is no undo button in My Inbox after approval. The recommended method is to restart the workflow by making a change or blocking/cancelling to halt subsequent steps.

SAP's useful documentation

  • Flexible Workflow for Purchase Orders (Public Cloud) ‚Äì setup and re-evaluation on change
  • Manage Purchase Orders (App ID F0842A) ‚Äì edit, block/unblock, delete flags
  • My Inbox ‚Äì approve/reject tasks (no cancel-after-approve function)

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: In SAP S/4 Hana Public Cloud for the OSS (One Stop Sh...
entry.content:
Hello @Fabiane_Melo74 

Thank you for your question.

Consult Country wise approach for One Stop Shop in Business ByDesign & Custom Analytical Queries for more details.

To summarise, the VAT One Stop Shop Return app is currently not available for Portugal while using public cloud. The recommended approach is to extract the necessary OSS data through standard reporting and or custom CDS views.

  • The Tax Line Item app can already give you values by tax code and tax amount.
  • If you need destination country and net sales values together, you can build a Custom CDS View on I_JournalEntryItem and I_TaxJournalEntryItem and expose it through Custom Analytical Queries. This gives you a reuseable report you can filter by country, tax code, net value and tax amount.
  • Alternatively, export the CDS output to Excel and use it for the OSS filing.

For you to fully automate OSS submission in Portugal, an integration or partner add-on may be required, since the official OSS return app for Portugal has not yet been delivered by SAP.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: What Does Each Block Item Control in 'Define Reasons...
entry.content:
Hi @SatoMasayoshi 

Thank you for your question.

In summary, each checkbox in the Define Reasons for Blocking in Shipping SSCUI controls a specific sub-process of sales order and delivery processing in public cloud. For example, order blocks SO creation, DlvDueListBlock prevents the order from appearing in the Delivery Due List, Pick.Block prevents warehouse picking, and GI Block stops Post Goods Issue. The Central Delivery Block filed in the Business Partner master will always block delivery creation as a baseline, regardless of which sub-process flags you have checked, which is why you still observed blocking even when all boxes were unticked. To test the effects, you can consider using Fiori apps such as Create Sales Orders, Run Outbound Delivery Creation, Manage Outbound Deliveries and Post Goods Issue for Outbound Delivery.

Consult Blocking Sites, Manage Customer Master Data & Outbound Deliveries for more details.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Alternative Account Change Blocked in S/4HANA Cloud P...
entry.content:
Hello @nbek 

You cannot change the Alternative Account (ALTKT) on a G/L that has non-zero balances in the current or previous years. That restriction (FH007) is intentional in S/4HANA Public Cloud, and there is no override. KBA 1650435 - Error message FH007 appears in TA FS00

How to stay compliant for FY 2025 (France/PCG):

Create new G/L accounts with the required French alternative account numbers for FY SAP Help-General Ledger Accounting-G/L Account Master Data: FAQ

Transfer asset accounting account determination retirements NBV, proceeds, clearing, etc, to the new G/Ls with a valid-from date of 01.01.2025 or the start of your financial year so that all 2025 postings are allocated to the correct alternative account. Leave historical years intact, no reposting of 2024.

Reporting: Enable the Alternative Account column in statutory reports, Financial Statement ‚Äì Actuals, and Trial Balance. This change ensures that auditors will see the correct PCG numbers starting from 2025; earlier years will continue to display the legacy mapping..KBA 3102866 - Alternative G/L Account for G/L Account - S/4HANA Cloud

If you need the G/Ls immediately in Production, use Synchronise G/L Account Master Data after creating them in Q. SAP Help-General Ledger Accounting-Synchronise G/L Account Master Data (Two-System Landscape)

Notes

The zero-then-change-then-reverse method is not allowed for closed or audited years and is limited by Cloud governance.

SAP‚Äôs recommended approach in Public Cloud is using a new G/L combined with valid-from switching in account determination. This method preserves audit history and complies with the legal change required by 2025.SAP Help General Ledger-Create and Edit Account Determination

Let me know if you need further support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Enabling 'Compliance' tab in Purchase order header &...
entry.content:
Hi @AdyashaPatra 

Thank you for your question.

In public cloud, the new compliance status fields in purchase orders (Embargo Screening, Legal Control) remain Not relevant, no check unless the document is actually synchronised and updated with GTS results. In addition to enabling them in Active Checks for Purchasing Documents, you must ensure that:

  • The SAP_COM_0594 communication arrangement for Trade Compliance with GTS is active.
  • Vendors and materials are flagged as relevant for compliance in master data.
  • The background job Check Compliance for Purchasing Documents is scheduled or triggered manually through the corresponding Fiori app so that the compliance statuses are updated.

Once you have put those in place, a PO blocked in GTS will correctly reflect the block in the Compliance ab fields in S4HC.

I recommend you consult Supplier Check in Purchasing Documents,  Trade Services Compliance & https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/ee9ee0ca4c3942068ea584d2f929b5b1/0f770376bbb84c0a8e7af82d24b5c87f.html?locale=en-US&version=2508.00 for more details.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

Hello @litox 

Your  first row changes because your $orderby is not unique, so $stop=1 can select a different tied row when $select changes. To make the sorting consistent, include the entity‚Äôs key fields or the generated ID) in both $select and $orderby,such as &$orderby=CompanyCode,FiscalYear,AccountingDocument,Ledger,AccountingDocumentItem. Even better, filter directly by the business key instead of relying on $top=1.

Check your inbox for detailed code

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: OAuth2.0 Authentication Error When Setting Up Comm. A...
entry.content:
Hi @Vynerfes 

Thank you for your question and the detailed screenshots.

I recommend you consult Setting Up a Communication System, Credentials for the OAuth 2.0 Client Creation & Electronic Invoicing in Malaysia for more details.

In summary, based on the screenshots you provided, the error message you are seeing occurs because the outbound OAuth2 configuration does not fully match what the IRBM API expects. In particular, with client credentials flow, S4HC will send grant_type=client_credentials automatically but only if the authorisation endpoint is left bland and the token endpoint is correctly set. If you include an unsupported scope or a mismatched endpoint, the token request fails with a generic OAuth error.

I recommend you check the following:

  • Leave Authorisation Endpoint blank.
  • Use only the Token Endpoint = .../connect/token.
  • Ensure Client Authorisation = Basic.
  • Only maintain scope if IRBM explicitly requires it

If IRBM requires additional non-standard fields in the token request, you must route through SAP Integration Suite to enrich the payload.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Required SAP for me access
entry.content:
Hi Gowtham,

To grant access to SAP for Me, it is essential that both users have an active S-user ID. Administrators listed under Users & Contacts - SAP for Me are authorized to create new S-user IDs for users.  

For detailed guidance on how administrators can create or delete S-user IDs, please refer to the KBA 1271482 - How does an administrator create or delete S-user IDs? - SAP for Me

Additionally, if the users need to manage SAP support cases (e.g., creating, closing, or replying to cases), they will require specific case-related authorizations. These permissions can be assigned based on varying levels, such as CCC level, customer number level, or installation number level, depending on your organization's needs.

The required authorizations are as follows:

  • Report Technical Problem
  • Close Cases (see KBA 2646108)
  • Send Cases to SAP (see KBA 2656179)
  • Display Cases
  • Display all Cases
  • Display Cloud Data (applies to SAP Cloud products only, e.g. SuccessFactors, refer to KBA 2598170)

For further details on support case handling authorizations, you can review KBA 3383142 - Which S-user ID authorizations are required for support case handling? - SAP for Me.

If you have any additional questions or need further clarification, please let me know. I am happy to assist you further.

Best regards,
SAP Support

entry.title: Re: Tax code rate is not displayed in Journal Entry - Cus...
entry.content:
Hello,

Please Note: because SAP only releases selected CDS views, the actual availabilities can vary by version or country.
Also: Some of the field names are inferred from SAP Help / API Hub documentation, community posts, or SAP‚Äôs ‚ÄúTax Code‚Äù documentation. Always confirm in your system‚Äôs View Browser / CDS Metadata.

CDS ViewPurpose / What It RepresentsKey Fields / ColumnsNotes / Comments
I_TaxCodeMaster data for tax codes (how tax is applied)- Country - Tax Code - Tax Type - Tax Calculation Procedure - Valid-From / Valid-To - Description / TextBasic tax-code master CDS. Does not reliably include the tax rate / percentage in published versions.
(Possible) I_TaxRateType or similarMaster / condition type view that holds tax rate percentages- Tax Rate Type (ID) - Tax Percentage / Rate - Validity or Effective Date - Country / JurisdictionNot always exposed or allowed in joins. Some CDS views may expose tax percentage.
(Associated) I_TaxCodeText / text viewsText / descriptive information for tax codes- Tax Code (key) - Language - Tax Code Name / Long DescriptionHelps with descriptions. Often linked to I_TaxCode via ‚Äú_Text‚Äù association.
(Transaction-related) I_JournalEntryItem / I_BillingDocumentItem etc.Transaction items where tax is posted- Tax Code - Amount / Base Amount / Tax Amount - Document / Company Code / CurrencyThese transactional views include tax amounts but not tax rate fields.
(If available / country-specific) ‚ÄúTax Information‚Äù CDS viewCombined view (sometimes in localized extensions)- Country - Tax Code - Tax PercentageSome localized CDS views may provide both tax code and tax percentage in one place, depending on country content delivery.

I hope this provides you some guidance.

entry.title: Re: Reverse Document Number
entry.content:
Hello @piyush_kr ,

Original Accounting Document
-The number assignment depends on the document type configuration in number ranges.
-SAP allows internal or external number assignment for original documents.
Example:
-Standard FI documents (like invoices, G/L postings) usually use internal numbers.
-Some business scenarios (like customer invoice numbers) may use external assignment if configured that way.

Reversal Document
-Always gets a new internal number automatically from its document type‚Äôs number range.
-You cannot manually assign or force it to be external.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: Levels in FSV
entry.content:
Hello @piyush_kr ,

In SAP S/4HANA, the Financial Statement Version (FSV) is structured hierarchically to represent accounts in a balance sheet or P&L.

The hierarchy in FSV can have up to 10 levels of nodes (groups / subgroups).
Level 1 ‚Üí Top node (e.g., Assets, Liabilities, P&L).
Level 2‚Äì9 ‚Üí Sub-nodes (e.g., Current Assets ‚Üí Cash ‚Üí Bank Accounts).
Level 10 ‚Üí Final level, usually the assignment of G/L accounts.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: Entering Trading Partner in Park supplier invoice App
entry.content:
Hello @willwong 

Thank you for pointing to KBA 3362094 ‚Äî SAP confirms that there is no Park function in that app KBA 2856664 KBA 2856664 - Create Incoming Invoices app has no park functionality - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

What is possible with S/4HANA Public Cloud

Park Supplier Invoices (LIV) facilitate parking but do not show the Trading Partner on the user interface. The preferred approach is to extract the Trading Partner from the Supplier Business Partner (bp) record, specifically by maintaining it under role FLVN00 in the BP, within Company Code ‚Üí Accounting Info ‚Üí Trading Partner. This method ensures that the value is included in accounting postings, even if it was not entered during parking. SAP Help Portal-Park Supplier Invoices

If you must key Trading Partners manually, then Create Incoming Invoices works for entry, but it cannot be parked; instead, you need to rely on Flexible Workflow for approval and controls rather than parking.

Given that, it seems there is no single app that allows both manually parking and entering a Trading Partner. Recommendation: continue using Park Supplier Invoices and ensure the Trading Partner is maintained on the vendor BP so the field is correctly populated at posting.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Optimizing Accessibility for Limited Mobility
entry.content:
Challenges affecting strength, dexterity, or fine motor control impact a wide range of people, with data showing significant prevalence among certain groups ‚Äîfor example, approximately 35% of adults experience mobility limitations by age 70[1]. However, designing for accessibility isn't just for people with permanent conditions. It also benefits anyone dealing with temporary or situational conditions that affect everyday life, like having a sprained wrist, using a device one-handed while carrying groceries, or trying to input information on a mobile device while riding on a bumpy road.

A woman with glasses smiles with her arms crossed. Text reads: ‚ÄúAround 35% of adults have mobility limitations by age 70. SAP designs for those with limited mobility. Check out our tips for focus order, shortcuts, motion alternatives and more!‚Äù

Design For Accessibility Is Design For Everyone

When we design with accessibility in mind, we're not just checking a box, we're creating digital experiences that are easier to use for everyone. Making interaction easier and tasks more achievable doesn't just help some users; it improves product quality across the board.

5 Tips to Optimize Accessibility for Those With Limited Mobility

Supporting users with limited mobility means designing for a broad range of abilities, from permanent conditions to temporary or situational mobility challenges. The guidance in SAP's Accessibility Design Tools, Second Edition, and the Inclusive Research Handbook helps turn this awareness into practical steps. With these resources in mind, here are five tips to help you get started:

1. Keyboard Functionality

  • Ensure all functionality is accessible via keyboard, such as Tab to navigate and Enter/Space to interact.
  • Maintain a logical tab order and ensure that users can navigate out of elements like pop-ups or forms with their keyboard.
  • Why? Limited mobility can make using a mouse difficult, especially when targeting small buttons or moving the cursor quickly across the screen, often causing strain and frequent errors.

2. Touch Target

  • Design buttons and interactive elements with a minimum touch target of 44√ó44 px.
  • Increase spacing between adjacent clickable items to reduce accidental activation.
  • Why? Small clickable areas can be difficult to activate accurately. This can result in missed or accidental clicks, especially for people using a touchscreen or anyone with difficulty with precise mouse control.

3. On-screen Buttons

  • For any action that requires a complex touch gesture, such as swiping or pinching, always provide a simple on-screen button that performs the same function.
  • Why? Multi-step gestures like pinch-to-zoom, swipe, long-press, and complex keyboard shortcuts such as Ctrl + Alt + Shift can be physically difficult or impossible for some users.

4. Shortcuts and Customizable Settings

  • Prioritize task efficiency by minimizing the number of steps required to complete tasks.
  • To reduce user effort, provide shortcuts and customizable settings, such as skip links or collapsible sections.
  • Why? Requiring long navigation paths or excessive interactions increases physical effort and can cause fatigue, particularly during repetitive or extended use.

5. Focus Indicators

  • Always provide clear, high-contrast focus indicators for all interactive elements.
  • Ensure the focus order is logical and predictable.
  • Why? Without a visible focus, keyboard users often cannot easily track their position on the page. This makes navigation difficult and increases the risk of activating the wrong element.

How SAP Designs with Accessibility in Mind

Technology keeps changing, but our commitment to Accessibility remains constant. We're focused on ensuring innovation moves forward without leaving anyone behind. To achieve that goal, we are actively innovating how accessibility considerations can be integrated in all parts of the Product Development Lifecycle, especially in early phases like design.

Want to dig deeper? Explore SAP's Accessibility Design Tools, Second Edition

 

References:

1. Frontiers in Physiology. (2020). Mobility in older community-dwelling persons: A narrative review. Frontiers in Physiology, 11, 881.
